name: Private Guided Tour of the Automotive Wonders of the World!
description: For a limited group of individuals, we will open out a treasure trove hidden in Bangalore! You will get to experience the restoration, preservation & collection of Historic Cars, Motorcycles, Carriages and all things automotive passionately built over the past 40 years!

location.address: Rajarajeshwari Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka, India

organizer.name: Classic Chase
organizer.description: Immerse yourself in an era gone by...

name: Malleswara Darshan heritage walk.
description: This is our walk in one of the oldest suburbs of the "old Bangalore". Join us on a 'darshan' of the many temples and other religious institutes that dot this area as we narrate to you its origins and about the celebrities/personalities who called it their 'home'. Also on this walk learn more about the Maratha connection to this neighborhood as well as how a philanthropist not only helped renovate the Kadu Malleswara temple but also helped create an entire lake in the days gone by.See how Kadu Malleswara turned into a "Mall-e-swarm" and is fast losing not only it's heritage structures but also its local culture. In between all the bytes of history we take bites from an iconic eatery in the this area.So join us on this walk next and get to know Malleswaram in a completely new light.

location.address: Sampige Road, Malleshwaram, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560003, India

organizer.name: Bengaluru by foot
organizer.description: Heritage, food & architectural walks in Bangalore.

name: The Breakfast Club
description: We’re excited to invite you to an exclusive breakfast and coffee preview of Muro Café, where Bangalore will experience the best of Asian breakfast and a celebration of Single Origin Coffees of Karnataka’s finest coffee estates. Join us on every Saturday & Sunday for our Asian breakfast menu.From 9 a.m. to 12:00 p.m., experience Muro Cafe's unique twist on breakfast; from rich Crab Omelettes and indulgent Hong Kong French Toast to creamy Basque Cheesecake & more.Celebrate food, community, and the joy of coming together. Muro: https://www.instagram.com/murocafeblr/

name: Magic: The Gathering with ReRoll Board Games
description: After many years of talking about this, we’re finally starting a Magic: The Gathering meetup. If you are curious about this massively popular card game, or are already a player looking to find others to play with in-person, this is for you!For people who’ve never played before:This is designed for new players to explore the game. We’ll teach you the rules, and will pair up new players with each other. We’ll be playing the with 40-card decks, using the Jumpstart 2022 set - which is a great way to learn the game without too much time on deck building.For experienced playersWe have a few premade standard (60 card) decks to play, as well a few commander decks.This is a light, friendly environment for players to explore the game and meet the community - it is not a competitive event. Be helpful, and expect people to make mistakes.

location.address: 24, 1st Main, 3rd Cross Road, 3rd Floor, above Blue Tokai 24, 3rd A Cross, 1st Main Rd, Defence Colony, Domlur, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560071, India

name: Kavitayon Ki Dastak
description: Dialogues Cafe brings to you a Sunday full of kavitā and shāyari!If you love writing or just listening to Hindi poetry or couplets of shāyari or lyrical ghazals — we invite you to a poetic sundowner filled with hindi writing and sher-shāyari. Let`s get together for `Kavitāyon Ki Dastak`, an open mic — or rather an open mehfil — to set your mood and make you feel wholesome."utth ke mehfil se mat chale jānātum se raushan ye konā konā hai"Be a part of this community, share the love and lehzā with your words. Come join us to have agood time reciting, listening and absorbing the creativity of Hindi artists and shāyars. Wrap up your week with mellow vibes and be rejuvenated to start the next week afresh!Venue: Dialogues Café, KoramangalaEvery Second Sunday of the MonthTime: 5:00 pm to 7:00 pm

location.address: 21, 80 Feet Rd, Nirguna Mandir Layout, 4th Block, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560095, India

organizer.name: Dialogues Cafe Private Limited
organizer.description: Dialogues Cafe is a warm, homely space in Koramangala where natural light meets community vibes. Enjoy freshly made, minimalist cuisine while engaging in open mics, book clubs, and more. Whether you’re here to work, create, or connect, Dialogues Cafe is your space to belong.

name: Dialogues with Books
description: Dialogues with Books Join us for our book club meetup every third Sunday of the month. Bring along your favorite book, the book you are currently reading, or any book that had an impact on you. Share your experience reading the book with fellow bibliophiles and participate in winding and fun discussions around the joy of reading. Do all this while sipping on coffee/tea or having a hot tasty snack from our cafe! Your Host - Bharat is an avid reader with a penchant for classical literature and philosophy. He also dabbles in writing with a diverse portfolio of works across tech, philosophy, magical realism and fantasy. His reading diet includes a mix of fiction and non-fiction with his favorite novels being The Great Gatsby by F. Scott Fitzgerald, The Movable feast by Hemmingway and Crime and Punishment by Dostoevsky.Note: Rs.100 as cover is part of the ticket price.

name: Smash Guys Burger Residency with Beer
description: Smash Guys Burger Residency with BeerThe Smash Guys Burger Residency with Beer marks a thrilling new chapter for The Conservatory, a space that has become a hotspot for culinary innovation over the past two years. We've hosted some of the country’s most exciting chefs and restaurants, recently venturing into international collaborations that have elevated Bengaluru’s dining scene.Now, we’re taking it one step further by introducing a unique residency experience—and who better to kick it off than the Smash Guys? With their expertly crafted burgers and a mission to redefine the city’s burger game, this month-long residency promises to be a delicious adventure you won’t want to miss.Smash Guys is the latest creation from Nikhil and AB Gupta, the culinary masterminds behind The Pizza Bakery and Paris Panini. This time, their mission is bold: to celebrate the art of the burger by bringing the finest styles from across the globe under one roof.After months of meticulously crafting every bite since their smash hit debut at The Conservatory, they’re now ready to take things up a notch with an exciting month-long residency.Smash Guys is here to redefine Bengaluru’s burger scene, filling the flavor void with juicy patties, crisp buns, and creative combinations that promise to thrill every burger lover in town.The dream team behind Smash Guys: Chef Guru is the Chef Partner at The Pizza Bakery & Paris Panini. Graduated from Le Cordon Bleu, Australia, his expertise in balancing textures and creating unique sauce combinations brings an unexpected twist to classic burger elements. His commitment to sourcing premium ingredients ensures every component tells its own story while contributing to a harmonious whole.Chef Adithya Kidambi is our friendly neighborhood kombucha scientist. He has built mossant into the best craft kombucha brand in the city, but what few know about him is that he is a trained Chef and self-taught burger scholar who delivered burgers to people during the lockdown post which he sold out at several pop-ups in the city. Adi excels in styles like the Nashville Chicken, Smash Buff/Lamb classics, and Asian-inspired burgers using ingredients like kimchi and miso.Chef Suby is all about chasing the ULTIMATE BURGER DREAM. His obsession with achieving the perfect meat-to-fat ratio and that caramelised crust has led him to experiment with countless grinds and smashing techniques. Chef Rohil brings an elegant touch to the veg side of our menu. He completes our trio with his innovative approach to flavour building, and fine-tuning the perfect balance of flavour and texture.Beer on TapTo make this residency even better, The Conservatory will be serving up refreshing beer on tap throughout the month. Pair your favorite Smash Guys burger with a perfectly chilled pint, and let the ultimate burger-and-beer experience begin!The Burger MenuNon- Vegetarian MenuBUFFALO FRIED CHICKEN (Rs. 585)buffalo sauce dunked fried chicken, grilled onions, blue cheese sauce, lettuce CRISPY CHICKEN DIPPER  (Rs.585)french dip dunked fried chicken, white onions, pickles, garlic aioli, lettuce. Served with a french gravy dip GRILLED TERIYAKI (Rs.585)teriyaki sauce dunked grilled chicken, togarashi flakes, pickles, garlic aioli, lettuce FOSTER CHICKEN SMASH (Rs.585)double smash chicken patty, cheese slice, chimichurri, pickles, smash sauce, lettuce OKLAHOMA ONION SMASH (BUFF/ LAMB) (Rs.650)double onion-smash patties, chimichurri, american cheese, pickles, smash sauce, lettuce CHILLI CHEESE SMASH  (BUFF/ LAMB) (Rs.650)double smash patties, american cheese, smash sauce, home-made chilli sofrito, chilli cheese BACON PEANUT BUTTER SMASH (Rs.689)single smash buff patty, american cheese, crispy bacon, crunchy peanut butter, sliced red paprika, smash sauce 8 HR. BRAISED BRISKET (Rs.689)single pickled-onion smash buff patty, double cheese, 8 hrs braised bbq brisket, smash sauce THE DALSTON DIP  (Rs.715)double buff smash patties, double cheese, grilled onions, smash sauce. Served with a home-made jus THE FLINTSTONE (Rs.715)single smash buff patty, american cheese, crispy bacon, torched bone marrow, pickles, smash sauce DIANE SMASH  (Rs.735)double buff smash patties, double cheese, diane sauce, grilled onions, smash sauce THE WELLINGTON  (Rs.735)double mustard-buff smash patties, crispy bacon, roasted mushroom, smash sauce. Served with a home-made jus Vegetarian MenuOYSTER MUSHROOM KARAAGE  (Rs. 520)fried oyster mushroom, togarashi flakes, pickles, truffle aioli, truffle oil, lettuce KOREAN FRIED PANEER (Rs. 598)gochujang glazed paneer, slaw, scallion relish, garlic aioli, lettuce BROCCOLI & CHEDDAR (Rs. 540)crumbed broccoli, cheddar & walnut patty, american cheese, jalapeño, smash sauce, lettuce BLACK BEAN (Rs. 520)crumbed black bean patty, cheese slice, chimichurri, white onions, pickles, smash sauce, lettuce SidesTRUFFLE FRIES (Rs.390)truffle aioli, parmesan, parsley SAUCY DIANE FRIES  (Rs.415)diane sauce (contains buff), bacon, smash sauce, parmesan, parsley DessertDEEP FRIED OREOS  (Rs.390)pancake-batter-dunked oreos, whipped custard, dulce de leche OLD MONK CHOCO MOUSSE (Rs.390)whipped custard, cocoa dust ﻿Terms and Conditions :Please note, INR 1000 from the ticket price is redeemable against the food and beverage menuGuests must be of a legal drinking age to consume alcohol at the eventKindly ensure you arrive promptly for your designated slot.The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during an eventConservatory is located on the 2nd floor of courtyard which is a 44 steps climb upDo not purchase tickets from anyone other than on the ticketing platform.No-shows and cancellations are non-refundable by all means.Tickets are non-transferable and are for personal use only.Children aged 7 and above require a ticket to attend the meal. If you are bringing a child under 7, please inform us in advance, as we do not have a baby seat at the venue.We cannot accommodate more than 8 people on a table.The schedule is subject to change in case of an emergency or any event out of our control.Management will entertain no liability or claims arising due to the consumption or intake of any food or drink.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Paid Valet Parking at Rs. 200 per car.The holder of this ticket grants organizers the right to use, in perpetuity, all or any part of the recording of any video or still footage made of the holder's appearance on any channel without any further approval.Please note that both vegetarian and non-vegetarian dishes are prepared in the same kitchen.The menu is subject to adjustments/ changes at the discretion of the chefs.Please note, tickets once booked cannot be shifted to another datePhotographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. name: A window into Kalaripayatt - Robin Philip
description: Step Into the World of Kalaripayatt with Urban KalariExperience the ancient wisdom of Kalaripayattu through a modern lens in this 2-day beginner-friendly workshop, A Window into Kalaripayatt. Guided by Robin Philip—an expert with over a decade of training under esteemed Gurukkals—this program breaks down the essence of this martial art into a relatable, accessible format.Workshop Highlights:Foundational Movements: Master basic stances, leg raises, jumps, and sequences.Self-Defense Reflexes: Learn six essential blocks to build muscle memory and confidence.Precision and Form: Avoid common errors and engage correctly for maximum impact.Flow and Connection: Practice two full-body flows for a seamless integration of movement.Kalari Philosophy: Discover the principles of Kalaripayattu and Kalari Chikilsa for a deeper mind-body connection.Who Should Join?This workshop is perfect for anyone curious about Kalari, seeking a holistic workout, exploring animal-inspired movement, or looking for practical self-defense skills. Whether you’re reconnecting with movement or starting fresh, this is your gateway to the profound art of Kalaripayattu.Rediscover the balance of strength, agility, and mindfulness. Join us and take the first step into this transformative journey!

name: Diaries of Heroes: Guided D&D Fantasy Journaling
description: Diaries of Heroes is where Dungeons & Dragons-inspired fantasy meets the depths of self-discovery and the peaks of creativity.We help you craft a unique hero—or anti-hero—who reflects your inner world, exploring their strengths, vulnerabilities, dreams, fears, and traumas in a safe and imaginative space.Breathe life into your character’s story through guided prompts, group discussions, and creative journaling. Add a touch of magic with vintage stickers, maps, and character portraits to create a keepsake as special as your hero. This workshop celebrates storytelling, community, and the transformative healing power of self-expression.What You’ll ExperienceWhat You'll Experience✨ We're providing a faux leather sheet, cardstock, 3 handmade cotton sheets, thread (for binding), leaf rope for making the diary. We're also have prints of maps, vintage stickers and character prints for decorating the journal. Bring any personal trinkets or your favourite calligraphy pens if you’d like to add an extra layer of embellishment to your creation.🛡️ Guided Character Development: We help you craft a character using D&D-inspired archetypes and your favourite fantasy novel frameworks.📖 Creative Journaling: Create a keepsake adorned with vintage decoratives to immortalize your character's journey. 🎭 Storytelling Circles: Share your hero’s lore with others, unmask your inner legend, and get a glimpse into the adventures awaiting your character.Whether you’re a seasoned role-player or brand new to character creation, this experience invites you to discover the hero within you!Who are ‘revry and friends’?revry is building a journaling community where you journal with friends and own the memories you create. revry and friends are radically reimagining writing as a unique, ownable art form in the new Web3 paradigm—transforming diary notes into timeless pieces of collectible art.Through the ‘What if Writing Were Like Paintings’ project, we explore how the world would change if personal creative expressions were seen as rare, collectible, and deeply meaningful—rather than fleeting content for the masses.

name: A 2 Day Kalaripayattu Workshop
description: We are hosting a 2-day Live Kalaripayattu workshop on 11th & 12 Jan 2025 (Saturday & Sunday)We are bringing to you Specially curated exercises inspired from Kalaripayattu that can be practised at the comfort of your home.What's included in the Workshop:A 2 Day Live workshop provided by Experienced Kalaripayattu Teachers on 11th & 12 Jan 2025 each.There would be 1.5 hours of a Online session 1 week prior to the workshop to brief you about the workshop and to provide Theoretical Introduction to the Kalaripayattu movements and to address other question and answers.Post workshop , there would be 1.5 hours of Online Session 1 week later to clear your doubts and address other issues related.Support through whatsapp / Call in future.This workshop is open for both Adults and Kids. There movements would be different and according to the respective age groupsBenefits of attending this Workshop:Learn Scientific , Natural Kalaripayattu Movements as a fitness routine to include in your day to day Lifestyle (no equipments required)Improve Mental Focus & MindfulnessDevelop A Stronger, Healthier Spine

name: End-of-the-Year Creative Reflections by Pieces S..
description: Wrap up the year with creativity and insights.The year could have been overwhelming, fun, hectic, surreal or all of these and more. There would not be enough adjectives to describe it. Therefore the workshop comes in handy. Join us for this fun experience as we come together to explore creativity and meaning through visuals to reflect on the year gone by. Whether you are a working professional, a student, or passionate about arts, you will find yourself working your way through visuals and letting your thoughts come to life.Join in to witness the chance and play of visuals and collage.What to expect:A guided session on how to link your very own experiences to images found in magazinesCreate collage based personalised artwork - no prior experience neededExploring various themes and ideas through visualsTakeawaysEach participant gets to make their very own artwork which would be the keepsake representing 2024.And an experience to remember 2024 before it ends.All materials to be provided which includes magazines (our rich image source), papers, scissors and glue.Who is Pieces Studio?Kanika Agarwal of Pieces Studio is a visual artist focusing on the medium of collage for over a decade. She is self-taught and finds herself exploring and expressing through paper often. Over the years, she has realised that the technique of collage making is powerful as it helps with strengthening intuition, and leads the way for exploring creativity. Her work can be found on Instagram @pieces_collage

name: New Year's Day Yoga + Brunch
description: Begin 2025 with a grounding and uplifting yoga flow, designed to clear away the past year's clutter and open your heart to the possibilities ahead. During this session, we’ll guide you through intention setting—a powerful practice to align your goals with your values.Afterward, savour a wholesome, plant-based brunch, crafted with freshness to fuel your year ahead.Join Sanchika, a Vinyasa, Breathwork, and Yoga Nidra teacher with over seven years of personal practice. She is passionate about exploring the connection between the mind, body, and breath, and she loves sharing that with others through creative and accessible Vinyasa flows.  Let’s celebrate new beginnings with mindfulness, meaningful connections, and delicious food at our beautiful, sunlit studio. Here’s to a year filled with growth + gratitude

Let’s welcome the new year together, from 8 PM onwards, 31st December. Catch the feeling. Release the rest.
